statements: The government should ensure that every person has access to affordable, high-quality basic healthcare, while allowing flexibility in how that coverage is delivered through a mix of public programs and regulated private options. Those who favor a larger public role can support clear national standards, subsidies, and protections against medical bankruptcy, while those who prefer market solutions can support competition, choice, and innovation within strong consumer safeguards. A practical consensus is for government to set the floor—universal access, transparency, and fair rules—and to partner with providers and insurers to deliver care efficiently and sustainably.
